item.title: Npc requeriment to attack
item.dc:creator: @frostscapeserver frostscapeserver
item.description:
@frostscapeserver wrote:

[quote author=I Vain I link=topic=440194.msg3234548#msg3234548 date=1276374624]
You’re saying the player needs the equipment, if they have the items…
Try this:

if (type == 1616) { if (playerLevel[18] < 10) { sM("You must be level 10 slayer or higher to attack this monster."); ResetAttackNPC(); return false; } } if (type == 1977) { if(!playerHasItem(2387) && !playerHasItem(689) && !playerHasItem(687)){ sM("You need the equipment."); ResetAttackNPC(); return false; } }

By the way, I’m pretty sure you want it to be

if (playerLevel[18] > 10) {

Not

if (playerLevel[18] < 10) {

Because < 10 means it’s less than 10

Read full topic

item.title: Npc requeriment to attack
item.dc:creator: @raulhenriq raulhenriq
item.description:
@raulhenriq wrote:

Hi, i am having a problem when adding a requirement to attack a npc. The thing is that I’m trying to copy the slayer requirements with one difference, else of need a slayer or any other level my idea is to make the requirement to be some items in the player inventory. This is the two codes, the slayer one that works and the one i’ve made that is not working (doesn’t gave any errors but also doesn’t work).

if (type == 1616) { if (playerLevel[18] < 10) { sM("You must be level 10 slayer or higher to attack this monster."); ResetAttackNPC(); return false; } } if (type == 1977) { if(playerHasItem(2387) && playerHasItem(689) && playerHasItem(687)){ sM("You need the equipments."); ResetAttackNPC(); return false; } }

So can please someone post a code similar to the second I’ve posted but that works? Thank you all (:

Read full topic
